column5: what should i expect at pasha lake cabins. any info?
The only thing I know about Pasha lake is from an episode of Fish'n'Canada.

The fishing can be incredible if you hit the right lakes. The locals make sure they keep their good spots a secret so do some exploring and be prepared to work a bit. If you're in good physical shape and can carry a small boat or canoe into a back lake, you should find decent fish.
Have heard nothing but good things about Pasha, you should do well.
This will give you a pretty good idea of what to expect:  http://www.forum.minnesotawaterfowler.com/viewtopic.php?t=19286&highlight=pasha
wow, I clicked solo's link...what an unbelievable area!
Looks like some great waters... why fellas with electric trolling motors would get out and push their boats, that's another story!

I've heard good things about North Wind but it can get incredibly rough on a windy day. Their boats are the right size for that lake but if you bring a 5 hp motor it will get you into a lot of smaller lakes where the resort has boats stashed. On one of our secret lakes we caught an average of 25 fish an hour each but we had to carry our motor, gas and equipment about a half mile...As far as I know the jackfish has a two fish limit and a slot size...
it looks good and the owner is giving us a discount so we decided to try it out this year
